clusters.title: Live: Zelensky meets Macron in Paris to boost European support amid peace talks
clusters.neutral_headline: Ukraine and US Officials Discuss Peace Deal Outlines

items.title: Live: Zelensky meets Macron in Paris to boost European support amid peace talks
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky meets French President Emmanuel Macron in Paris on Monday, seeking to bolster European support as US President Donald Trump expressed optimism about a potential peace deal to end Russia's war in Ukraine. The meeting follows talks in Florida between US and Ukrainian negotiators that both sides described as "productive". Follow our liveblog for the latest updates.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky meets French President Emmanuel Macron in Paris on Monday, seeking to bolster European support as US President Donald Trump expressed optimism about a potential peace deal to end Russia's war in Ukraine. The meeting follows talks in Florida between US and Ukrainian negotiators that both sides described as "productive". Follow our liveblog for the latest updates.

items.title: Post-war borders dominated "intense" U.S.-Ukraine talks
items.standfirst: Negotiations between the U.S. and Ukraine on Sunday focused on where the de facto border with Russia would be drawn under a peace deal, two Ukrainian officials tell Axios. They described the five-hour meeting as "difficult" and "intense," but productive. Why it matters: Russian President Vladimir…
items.content: Negotiations between the U.S. and Ukraine on Sunday focused on where the de facto border with Russia would be drawn under a peace deal, two Ukrainian officials tell Axios. They described the five-hour meeting as "difficult" and "intense," but productive. Why it matters: Russian President Vladimir…

items.title: Russia-Ukraine war rages on as U.S. hosts more peace talks
items.standfirst: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said Sunday's talks with Ukraine about a U.S. plan to end the war with Russia were productive, but there's "more work to be done." Fighting continued between the two countries over the weekend, as Holly Williams reports from Warsaw.
items.content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said Sunday's talks with Ukraine about a U.S. plan to end the war with Russia were productive, but there's "more work to be done." Fighting continued between the two countries over the weekend, as Holly Williams reports from Warsaw.

items.title: Rubio: Ukraine peace discussions ‘productive’ after critical Florida meeting
items.standfirst: Secretary of State Marco Rubio met with Ukrainian officials in Florida for a round of peace discussions. Officials from both countries called the meeting “productive.” NBC News’ Raf Sanchez reports.
items.content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio met with Ukrainian officials in Florida for a round of peace discussions. Officials from both countries called the meeting “productive.” NBC News’ Raf Sanchez reports.

items.title: Ukraine talks 'productive' but more work needed, Rubio says
items.standfirst: American and Ukrainian delegations meet in Florida to discuss the outlines of a peace deal with Russia.
items.content: American and Ukrainian delegations meet in Florida to discuss the outlines of a peace deal with Russia.

items.title: U.S. and Ukrainian officials hold 'very productive' meeting in Florida
items.standfirst: Top U.S. officials and a Ukrainian delegation met in Florida on Sunday for the latest round of discussions on a plan to end the war between Russia and Ukraine — talks both sides described positively but about which they provided no details and took no questions."Much work remains, but today was, again, a very productive and useful session where I think additional progress was made," Secretary of State Marco Rubio said in short remarks to reporters after the meeting.
items.content: Top U.S. officials and a Ukrainian delegation met in Florida on Sunday for the latest round of discussions on a plan to end the war between Russia and Ukraine — talks both sides described positively but about which they provided no details and took no questions."Much work remains, but today was, again, a very productive and useful session where I think additional progress was made," Secretary of State Marco Rubio said in short remarks to reporters after the meeting.

items.title: Rubio has ‘very productive’ peace discussions with Ukrainian officials
items.standfirst: Secretary of State Marco Rubio met with Ukrainian officials in Florida for a round of peace discussions. Rubio called it a “very productive session” but also noted “much more work remains.”
items.content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio met with Ukrainian officials in Florida for a round of peace discussions. Rubio called it a “very productive session” but also noted “much more work remains.”

items.title: Ukrainian and US officials meet in Florida to discuss proposals to end Russia’s war
items.standfirst: Marco Rubio, Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner meet Kyiv delegation amid more deadly Russian attacks in UkraineUkrainian negotiators have met US officials in Florida to thrash out details of Washington’s proposed framework to end Russia’s war in Ukraine, as Kyiv faces pressure on military and political fronts.The secretary of state, Marco Rubio; the special envoy, Steve Witkoff; and Jared Kushner, Donald Trump’s son-in-law; sat down with a Ukrainian delegation on Sunday before planned US talks this week in Moscow with Vladimir Putin. Continue reading...
items.content: Marco Rubio, Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner meet Kyiv delegation amid more deadly Russian attacks in UkraineUkrainian negotiators have met US officials in Florida to thrash out details of Washington’s proposed framework to end Russia’s war in Ukraine, as Kyiv faces pressure on military and political fronts.The secretary of state, Marco Rubio; the special envoy, Steve Witkoff; and Jared Kushner, Donald Trump’s son-in-law; sat down with a Ukrainian delegation on Sunday before planned US talks this week in Moscow with Vladimir Putin. Continue reading...

items.title: Rubio says US-Ukraine talks on ending war ‘productive’ but ‘complicated’
items.standfirst: Delegations meet in Florida to ‘create pathway’ for sovereign Ukraine ahead of US special envoy Witkoff’s Moscow trip.
items.content: Delegations meet in Florida to ‘create pathway’ for sovereign Ukraine ahead of US special envoy Witkoff’s Moscow trip.

items.title: Rubio says US-Ukraine talks on Russia war were productive but much work remains in search of a deal
items.standfirst: U.S. and Ukrainian officials completed roughly four hours of talks aimed at finding an endgame to the war between Russia and Ukraine.
items.content: U.S. and Ukrainian officials completed roughly four hours of talks aimed at finding an endgame to the war between Russia and Ukraine.(Image credit: Terry Renna)

items.title: Trump officials to sit down with Ukrainian negotiators in Florida
items.standfirst: Top Trump administration officials including Secretary of State Marco Rubio, Special Envoy Steve Witkoff are meeting Ukrainian negotiators in Florida this weekend. The meeting comes after the resignation of Ukraine's top negotiator and chief of staff, Andrii Yermak, due to an anti-graft probe. FRANCE 24's Gulliver Cragg brings you the latest.
items.content: Top Trump administration officials including Secretary of State Marco Rubio, Special Envoy Steve Witkoff are meeting Ukrainian negotiators in Florida this weekend. The meeting comes after the resignation of Ukraine's top negotiator and chief of staff, Andrii Yermak, due to an anti-graft probe. FRANCE 24's Gulliver Cragg brings you the latest.

items.title: Rubio and Witkoff to meet with Ukraine's negotiators in Florida
items.standfirst: Top Trump administration officials are meeting Ukrainian negotiators in Florida this weekend, pushing to broker an end to Russia's war in Ukraine and setting the stage for key talks planned this week in Moscow with Russian leader Vladimir Putin, Secretary of State Marco Rubio, Special Envoy Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner, the son-in-law of US President Donald Trump, were expected to sit down with a Ukrainian delegation to further hash out the details of a proposed peace framework.
items.content: Top Trump administration officials are meeting Ukrainian negotiators in Florida this weekend, pushing to broker an end to Russia's war in Ukraine and setting the stage for key talks planned this week in Moscow with Russian leader Vladimir Putin, Secretary of State Marco Rubio, Special Envoy Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner, the son-in-law of US President Donald Trump, were expected to sit down with a Ukrainian delegation to further hash out the details of a proposed peace framework.

items.title: Too many cooks? Trump’s growing army of Ukraine negotiators
items.standfirst: With the quartet of Marco Rubio, Steve Witkoff, Jared Kushner and Daniel Driscoll, US President Donald Trump’s team of negotiators pushing for peace in Ukraine seems to be growing by the minute. And they are all throwing their own ideas and strategies into the mix. Facing them is Russian President Vladimir Putin's trusted aide Kirill Dmitriev, whose diplomatic one-man show has steadfastly advanced the Kremlin’s demands.
items.content: With the quartet of Marco Rubio, Steve Witkoff, Jared Kushner and Daniel Driscoll, US President Donald Trump’s team of negotiators pushing for peace in Ukraine seems to be growing by the minute. And they are all throwing their own ideas and strategies into the mix. Facing them is Russian President Vladimir Putin's trusted aide Kirill Dmitriev, whose diplomatic one-man show has steadfastly advanced the Kremlin’s demands.

ai_summary: US and Ukrainian officials met in Florida to discuss a plan to end the war with Russia.
Both sides described the meeting as productive, but details remain undisclosed.
Discussions focused on the potential drawing of the de facto border with Russia.
Secretary of State Marco Rubio called the discussions "productive" after the meeting.
The meeting followed talks between US and Ukrainian negotiators in Florida.

clusters.title: Israelis protest in Tel Aviv after Netanyahu seeks pardon on fraud cases
clusters.neutral_headline: Netanyahu Seeks Pardon in Corruption Trial

items.title: Israelis protest in Tel Aviv after Netanyahu seeks pardon on fraud cases
items.standfirst: Protesters rally outside President Isaac Herzog's home demanding he reject the prime minister's request for a pardon.
items.content: Protesters rally outside President Isaac Herzog's home demanding he reject the prime minister's request for a pardon.

items.title: Israel’s Netanyahu seeks pardon to end corruption trial
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu asked the country’s president on Sunday for a pardon in his long-running corruption trial, arguing that the criminal proceedings were hindering his ability to govern and that a pardon would be good for Israel. Under Israeli law, however, the president does not have the power to pardon someone who is not a convicted criminal, FRANCE 24’s Noga Tarnopolsky said, noting that no verdict has yet been rendered on Netanyahu, who is actively seeking to prevent his trial from reaching its conclusion.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu asked the country’s president on Sunday for a pardon in his long-running corruption trial, arguing that the criminal proceedings were hindering his ability to govern and that a pardon would be good for Israel. Under Israeli law, however, the president does not have the power to pardon someone who is not a convicted criminal, FRANCE 24’s Noga Tarnopolsky said, noting that no verdict has yet been rendered on Netanyahu, who is actively seeking to prevent his trial from reaching its conclusion.

items.title: Netanyahu requests Israel’s president grant a pardon in corruption cases
items.standfirst: Benjamin Netanyahu has requested a formal pardon from President Isaac Herzog in his long-running corruption cases.
items.content: Benjamin Netanyahu has requested a formal pardon from President Isaac Herzog in his long-running corruption cases.

items.title: Netanyahu submits formal request for pardon in long-running corruption trial
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said the request would help unify the country at a time of momentous changes in the region.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said the request would help unify the country at a time of momentous changes in the region.

items.title: Netanyahu seeks pardon on corruption charges after getting Trump's backing
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has submitted a request for a formal pardon amid a yearslong corruption trial, just weeks after President Donald Trump said he should be pardoned.“Today, my lawyers submitted a request for clemency to the President of the State,” Netanyahu said in a video address posted on X Sunday.“The continuation of the trial is tearing us apart from within, provoking fierce divisions, intensifying divisions,” he said.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has submitted a request for a formal pardon amid a yearslong corruption trial, just weeks after President Donald Trump said he should be pardoned.“Today, my lawyers submitted a request for clemency to the President of the State,” Netanyahu said in a video address posted on X Sunday.“The continuation of the trial is tearing us apart from within, provoking fierce divisions, intensifying divisions,” he said.

items.title: Benjamin Netanyahu asks Israel’s president for pardon in corruption case
items.standfirst: Request is submitted weeks after Donald Trump called on Isaac Herzog to pardon Israeli prime ministerBenjamin Netanyahu has asked Israel’s president for a pardon for bribery and fraud charges and an end to a five-year corruption trial, arguing that it would be in the “national interest”.Isaac Herzog’s office acknowledged receipt of the 111-page submission from the prime minister’s lawyer, and said it had been passed on to the pardons department in the ministry of justice. The president’s legal adviser would also formulate an opinion before Herzog made a decision, it added. Continue reading...
items.content: Request is submitted weeks after Donald Trump called on Isaac Herzog to pardon Israeli prime ministerBenjamin Netanyahu has asked Israel’s president for a pardon for bribery and fraud charges and an end to a five-year corruption trial, arguing that it would be in the “national interest”.Isaac Herzog’s office acknowledged receipt of the 111-page submission from the prime minister’s lawyer, and said it had been passed on to the pardons department in the ministry of justice. The president’s legal adviser would also formulate an opinion before Herzog made a decision, it added. Continue reading...

items.title: Benjamin Netanyahu seeks pardon from Israel's president
items.standfirst: He denies any wrongdoing in three ongoing trials over allegations of bribery, fraud and breach of trust.
items.content: He denies any wrongdoing in three ongoing trials over allegations of bribery, fraud and breach of trust.

items.title: Israeli PM Netanyahu turns to president for pardon in ongoing trial
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has asked Israel’s president to grant him a pardon amid his long-running corruption trial, which has bitterly divided the country. After requesting multiple delays in the proceedings, Netanyahu has put himself in what FRANCE 24’s Noga Tarnopolsky described as a “paradoxical situation.” He previously persuaded the Supreme Court to allow him to run for office, yet now argues it is impossible for him to testify while leading the country, Tarnopolsky said, reporting from Jerusalem.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has asked Israel’s president to grant him a pardon amid his long-running corruption trial, which has bitterly divided the country. After requesting multiple delays in the proceedings, Netanyahu has put himself in what FRANCE 24’s Noga Tarnopolsky described as a “paradoxical situation.” He previously persuaded the Supreme Court to allow him to run for office, yet now argues it is impossible for him to testify while leading the country, Tarnopolsky said, reporting from Jerusalem.

items.title: Netanyahu submits request for a pardon during his ongoing corruption trial
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has asked Israel's president to grant him a pardon during his long-running corruption trial that's bitterly divided the country.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has asked Israel's president to grant him a pardon during his long-running corruption trial that's bitterly divided the country.(Image credit: Ohad Zwigenberg)

items.title: Netanyahu seeks pardon from Israeli president in corruption case
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Sunday submitted a formal pardon request in his long-running corruption cases to the Israeli presidential office. The extraordinary appeal is now under review by President Isaac Herzog, whose office said the decision carries “significant implications.” Dozens of protesters demonstrated outside Herzog's private home in Tel Aviv, urging him to reject Netanyahu's request.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Sunday submitted a formal pardon request in his long-running corruption cases to the Israeli presidential office. The extraordinary appeal is now under review by President Isaac Herzog, whose office said the decision carries “significant implications.” Dozens of protesters demonstrated outside Herzog's private home in Tel Aviv, urging him to reject Netanyahu's request.

items.title: Netanyahu submits request to Israeli president to pardon him
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, who is facing a long-running corruption trial, has submitted an official request to the country's president to pardon him.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, who is facing a long-running corruption trial, has submitted an official request to the country's president to pardon him.

ai_summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu requested a pardon from the president.
The request is related to his ongoing corruption trial.
Netanyahu stated the trial is hindering his ability to govern.
The president's power to pardon is limited under Israeli law.
Donald Trump recently called for Netanyahu to be pardoned.

clusters.title: Trump confirms call with Maduro, Venezuela slams US attack preparations
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump Confirms Call with Maduro, Venezuela Reacts

items.title: Trump confirms call with Maduro, Venezuela slams US attack preparations
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump said Sunday he had recently spoken with Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro as tensions surged, while Caracas accused Washington of preparing an attack. The United States has tightened pressure with a military buildup in the Caribbean, branding an alleged Maduro-run drug cartel a terrorist group, and warning that Venezuelan airspace is "closed".
items.content: US President Donald Trump said Sunday he had recently spoken with Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro as tensions surged, while Caracas accused Washington of preparing an attack. The United States has tightened pressure with a military buildup in the Caribbean, branding an alleged Maduro-run drug cartel a terrorist group, and warning that Venezuelan airspace is "closed".

items.title: Trump confirms he recently spoke with Venezuela’s Nicolás Maduro
items.standfirst: Trump remained tight-lipped on details of call with Venezuelan president as tensions rise between countriesDonald Trump confirmed on Sunday that he had spoken with Venezuelan president Nicolás Maduro, but he did not provide details on what the two leaders discussed.“I don’t want to comment on it. The answer is yes,” the US president said when asked if he had spoken with Maduro. He was speaking to reporters onboard Air Force One. Continue reading...
items.content: Trump remained tight-lipped on details of call with Venezuelan president as tensions rise between countriesDonald Trump confirmed on Sunday that he had spoken with Venezuelan president Nicolás Maduro, but he did not provide details on what the two leaders discussed.“I don’t want to comment on it. The answer is yes,” the US president said when asked if he had spoken with Maduro. He was speaking to reporters onboard Air Force One. Continue reading...

items.title: What is driving US President’s Trump’s actions against Venezuela?
items.standfirst: Donald Trump declared Venezuela's airspace 'closed' on Saturday.
items.content: Donald Trump declared Venezuela's airspace 'closed' on Saturday.

items.title: Venezuela calls Trump's call to close airspace a 'colonialist threat'
items.standfirst: President Trump said that the airspace "above and surrounding Venezuela" was "closed in its entirety". In response, the Venezuelan government said his comments violate international law, and are a "colonialist threat" to its sovereignty.
items.content: President Trump said that the airspace "above and surrounding Venezuela" was "closed in its entirety". In response, the Venezuelan government said his comments violate international law, and are a "colonialist threat" to its sovereignty.(Image credit: Alex Brandon)

items.title: Is US President Donald Trump preparing to strike Venezuela?
items.standfirst: Venezuela slams Trump's warning that its airspace should be considered closed amid rising tensions.
items.content: Venezuela slams Trump's warning that its airspace should be considered closed amid rising tensions.

items.title: Venezuela condemns Trump airspace closure warning
items.standfirst: The US says it is fighting drugs smuggling, but Venezuela says Donald Trump's aim is to topple President Nicolás Maduro.
items.content: The US says it is fighting drugs smuggling, but Venezuela says Donald Trump's aim is to topple President Nicolás Maduro.

items.title: Venezuela denounces ‘colonialist threat’ as Trump orders airspace closed
items.standfirst: President made declaration in a social media post, after FAA last week warned airlines of ‘worsening security situation’The Venezuelan government has responded defiantly to the heightened pressure by the US government, including Donald Trump’s recent statements on Saturday that the airspace above and surrounding Venezuela is to be closed in its entirety.In a statement, the Venezuelan government said Trump’s comments are a “colonialist threat” against their sovereignty and violate international law. The government also said it demanded respect for its airspace and would not accept foreign orders or threats. Continue reading...
items.content: President made declaration in a social media post, after FAA last week warned airlines of ‘worsening security situation’The Venezuelan government has responded defiantly to the heightened pressure by the US government, including Donald Trump’s recent statements on Saturday that the airspace above and surrounding Venezuela is to be closed in its entirety.In a statement, the Venezuelan government said Trump’s comments are a “colonialist threat” against their sovereignty and violate international law. The government also said it demanded respect for its airspace and would not accept foreign orders or threats. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump tells airlines Venezuela's airspace is 'closed in its entirety' in latest escalation
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump said Saturday morning that Venezuela’s airspace should be considered “closed” as he weighs military action against the South American nation.
items.content: President Donald Trump said Saturday morning that Venezuela’s airspace should be considered “closed” as he weighs military action against the South American nation.

ai_summary: Donald Trump confirmed he recently spoke with Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro.
Trump did not provide details about the content of their conversation.
Venezuela accused the US of preparing an attack.
The US has tightened pressure with a military buildup in the Caribbean.
Venezuela's airspace was declared "closed" by Trump.

clusters.title: Bangladesh court sentences UK MP Tulip Siddiq to two years prison in absentia
clusters.neutral_headline: Bangladesh Court Sentences UK MP Tulip Siddiq

items.title: Bangladesh court sentences UK MP Tulip Siddiq to two years prison in absentia
items.standfirst: Siddiq, who serves as an MP for Hampstead and Highgate in London, has denied the allegationsA Bangladesh court has sentenced British MP and former minister Tulip Siddiq to two years in jail, in a corruption case involving the alleged illegal allocation of a plot of land.Siddiq, who serves as an MP for Hampstead and Highgate in London, had denied the allegations and the trial was conducted in her absence. Continue reading...
items.content: Siddiq, who serves as an MP for Hampstead and Highgate in London, has denied the allegationsA Bangladesh court has sentenced British MP and former minister Tulip Siddiq to two years in jail, in a corruption case involving the alleged illegal allocation of a plot of land.Siddiq, who serves as an MP for Hampstead and Highgate in London, had denied the allegations and the trial was conducted in her absence. Continue reading...

items.title: Bangladesh Court Sentences Ex-UK Minister Siddiq to Two Years
Labour MP Tulip Siddiq sentenced to two years in prison at corruption trial in Bangladesh
items.standfirst: Labour MP Tulip Siddiq has been sentenced to two years in jail for corruption in Bangladesh.
items.content: Labour MP Tulip Siddiq has been sentenced to two years in jail for corruption in Bangladesh.

items.title: UK MP Tulip Siddiq given jail sentence in Bangladesh after trial in her absence
items.standfirst: The former minister and niece of Bangladesh's ousted former leader, who received a two-year sentence, says the charges are politically motivated.
items.content: The former minister and niece of Bangladesh's ousted former leader, who received a two-year sentence, says the charges are politically motivated.

ai_summary: A Bangladesh court sentenced UK MP Tulip Siddiq to two years in prison.
The sentence is related to a corruption case.
The trial was conducted in Siddiq's absence.
Siddiq has denied the allegations against her.
She is a former minister and niece of Bangladesh's ousted leader.

clusters.title: Manhunt Underway After 3 Children Killed at California Birthday Party
clusters.neutral_headline: Shooting at child's birthday party in Stockton kills 4, injures 11; shooter remains at large

items.title: Manhunt Underway After 3 Children Killed at California Birthday Party
items.standfirst: Authorities seek the public's help finding the shooter who killed 3 children, 1 adult at a California birthday party on Saturday.
items.content: Authorities seek the public's help finding the shooter who killed 3 children, 1 adult at a California birthday party on Saturday.

items.title: Shooting at child's birthday party in Stockton kills 4, injures 11; shooter remains at large
items.standfirst: Three children were among the four people killed, the San Joaquin County Sheriff's Office said. The victims were 8, 9, 14, and 21 years old.
items.content: Three children were among the four people killed, the San Joaquin County Sheriff's Office said. The victims were 8, 9, 14, and 21 years old.

items.title: Search for perpetrator continues after California shooting kills 4
items.standfirst: The hunt is on for the possible suspects in Saturday's mass shooting in Stockton, California, that killed four people, three of them children. Eleven others were wounded. CBS Sacramento's Madisen Keavy has the latest.
items.content: The hunt is on for the possible suspects in Saturday's mass shooting in Stockton, California, that killed four people, three of them children. Eleven others were wounded. CBS Sacramento's Madisen Keavy has the latest.

items.title: Three children among four killed in shooting at 'birthday party' in California
items.standfirst: Officials say 11 others are injured in what they believe is a "targeted" shooting at a children's birthday party.
items.content: Officials say 11 others are injured in what they believe is a "targeted" shooting at a children's birthday party.

items.title: California police search for suspect who killed four including three children at family party
items.standfirst: Victims who died in Stockton attack reportedly between ages eight and 21, while 11 others were woundedPolice are searching for the suspect who killed four people, including three children, and injured 11 in a shooting at a family gathering in Stockton, California, on Saturday night – and they are appealing to the public for any tips people may have.“If you have surveillance footage, if you’re a local business here, if you’re in the area, live in the area, or maybe you’ve heard rumors – please contact the sheriff’s office,” said Heather Brent, a spokesperson for the San Joaquin county sheriff’s office. Continue reading...
items.content: Victims who died in Stockton attack reportedly between ages eight and 21, while 11 others were woundedPolice are searching for the suspect who killed four people, including three children, and injured 11 in a shooting at a family gathering in Stockton, California, on Saturday night – and they are appealing to the public for any tips people may have.“If you have surveillance footage, if you’re a local business here, if you’re in the area, live in the area, or maybe you’ve heard rumors – please contact the sheriff’s office,” said Heather Brent, a spokesperson for the San Joaquin county sheriff’s office. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A shooting at a birthday party in Stockton, California, resulted in four deaths.
Three of the deceased were children, aged 8, 9, and 14 years old.
Eleven other people were injured in the shooting.
Authorities are searching for the shooter.
The shooting is believed to be targeted.

clusters.title: More arrests made in Hong Kong corruption probe as fire death toll climbs to 146
clusters.neutral_headline: Hong Kong Apartment Fire Death Toll Rises to 146

items.title: More arrests made in Hong Kong corruption probe as fire death toll climbs to 146
items.standfirst: The inferno that tore through a high-rise housing complex in Hong Kong has killed at least 146 people, authorities said Sunday, with around 40 still missing
items.content: The inferno that tore through a high-rise housing complex in Hong Kong has killed at least 146 people, authorities said Sunday, with around 40 still missing

items.title: Death toll in Hong Kong housing estate fire rises to 146 as the city grieves
items.standfirst: The death toll from a devastating fire at a Hong Kong apartment complex blaze rose to at least 146 on Sunday as more bodies were recovered from the charred remains of the Wang Fuk Court buildings. More than a thousand people queued near the housing complex on Sunday to pay tribute to the victims.
items.content: The death toll from a devastating fire at a Hong Kong apartment complex blaze rose to at least 146 on Sunday as more bodies were recovered from the charred remains of the Wang Fuk Court buildings. More than a thousand people queued near the housing complex on Sunday to pay tribute to the victims.

items.title: Hong Kong mourns as apartment fire death toll rises to 146
items.standfirst: Rescue teams find more bodies in burnt-out buildings of Wang Fuk Court complex after Wednesday’s fireThe death toll in Hong Kong’s apartment complex fire has risen to 146 after investigators discovered more bodies in the burnt-out buildings. A steady stream of people placed bouquets of flowers at an ever-growing makeshift memorial at the scene of the disaster, among the worst in the city’s history.The Hong Kong police’s disaster victim identification unit has been going through the buildings of the Wang Fuk Court complex meticulously and has found bodies both in apartment units and on the roofs, the officer in charge, Cheng Ka-chun, said on Sunday. Continue reading...
items.content: Rescue teams find more bodies in burnt-out buildings of Wang Fuk Court complex after Wednesday’s fireThe death toll in Hong Kong’s apartment complex fire has risen to 146 after investigators discovered more bodies in the burnt-out buildings. A steady stream of people placed bouquets of flowers at an ever-growing makeshift memorial at the scene of the disaster, among the worst in the city’s history.The Hong Kong police’s disaster victim identification unit has been going through the buildings of the Wang Fuk Court complex meticulously and has found bodies both in apartment units and on the roofs, the officer in charge, Cheng Ka-chun, said on Sunday. Continue reading...

items.title: Death toll rises in Hong Kong apartment complex fire as more bodies found in burned buildings
items.standfirst: The death toll from a fire that tore through a Hong Kong apartment complex has risen.
items.content: The death toll from a fire that tore through a Hong Kong apartment complex has risen.

ai_summary: The death toll from a Hong Kong apartment fire has risen to 146.
The fire occurred in a high-rise housing complex.
More bodies were recovered from the burnt-out buildings.
The disaster is one of the worst in the city's history.
Authorities are still searching for missing individuals.

clusters.title: Early Honduras election results show Trump-backed man ahead

items.title: Early Honduras election results show Trump-backed man ahead

items.content: The US president is threatening to cut aid to Honduras if his favoured right-wing presidential candidate does not win.

items.title: Honduras votes for new president in poll overshadowed by Trump’s threats

items.content: The vote is taking place in a highly polarised climate, with the US backing the right-wing candidate, Nasry Asfura.

items.title: Hondurans vote amid Trump threat to cut aid if his preferred candidate loses
items.standfirst: US president favours Nasry ‘Tito’ Asfura of rightwing National party, as polls show three candidates are neck-and-neckHondurans have begun voting in an election held amid threats by Donald Trump to cut aid to the country if his preferred candidate loses.Honduras could be the next country in Latin America, after Argentina and Bolivia, to swing right after years of leftwing rule. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Honduras held an election for a new president.
Donald Trump threatened to cut aid if his preferred candidate loses.
The US is backing the right-wing candidate, Nasry Asfura.
Early results show the Trump-backed candidate ahead.
The election is taking place in a highly polarized climate.

clusters.title: Gaza death toll rises to 70,000 as repeated outbreaks of violence test ceasefire
clusters.neutral_headline: Gaza Death Toll Surpasses 70,000

items.title: Gaza death toll rises to 70,000 as repeated outbreaks of violence test ceasefire
items.standfirst: Israeli attacks in Gaza have killed more than 70,000 people in over two years of war, according to the Palestinian Health Ministry, as the death toll continues to climb.
items.content: Israeli attacks in Gaza have killed more than 70,000 people in over two years of war, according to the Palestinian Health Ministry, as the death toll continues to climb.

items.title: More than 70,000 killed in Gaza since Israel offensive began, Hamas-run health ministry says
items.standfirst: Two young brothers were among the latest killed - reportedly in an Israeli air strike as the Gaza ceasefire remains fragile.
items.content: Two young brothers were among the latest killed - reportedly in an Israeli air strike as the Gaza ceasefire remains fragile.

items.title: Gaza death toll surpasses 70,000, says health ministry
items.standfirst: Two Palestinian children reportedly killed on Saturday as Israel continues its strikes after latest ceasefireThe Palestinian death toll has surpassed 70,000 since the Israel-Gaza war began, Gaza’s health ministry said on Saturday, while a hospital reported Israeli fire killed two Palestinian children in the territory’s south.The toll has continued to rise after the latest ceasefire took effect on 10 October. Israel still carries out strikes in response to what it has called violations of the truce, and bodies from earlier in the war are being recovered from the rubble. Continue reading...
items.content: Two Palestinian children reportedly killed on Saturday as Israel continues its strikes after latest ceasefireThe Palestinian death toll has surpassed 70,000 since the Israel-Gaza war began, Gaza’s health ministry said on Saturday, while a hospital reported Israeli fire killed two Palestinian children in the territory’s south.The toll has continued to rise after the latest ceasefire took effect on 10 October. Israel still carries out strikes in response to what it has called violations of the truce, and bodies from earlier in the war are being recovered from the rubble. Continue reading...

The deaths occurred since the start of the Israel-Gaza war.

Two young brothers were among the latest killed in an air strike.
The ceasefire remains fragile.

items.content: Separate weather systems brought torrential rainfall to Sri Lanka and large parts of Indonesia’s Sumatra, southern Thailand and northern Malaysia How cyclones and monsoon rains combined to devastate parts of Asia – visual guide Sri Lanka and Indonesia have deployed military personnel to help victims of devastating flooding that has killed nearly 1,000 people across four countries in Asia in recent days.Separate weather systems brought torrential, extended rainfall to the entire island of Sri Lanka and large parts of Indonesia’s Sumatra, southern Thailand and northern Malaysia last week. items.title: Sri Lanka, Indonesia deploy military as regional floods leave more than 1,000 dead
items.standfirst: Sri Lanka and Indonesia deployed troops on Monday to assist survivors of severe flooding that has killed more than 1,000 people across four Asian countries. Torrential rains swept Sri Lanka, Indonesia’s Sumatra, southern Thailand and northern Malaysia last week, with separate weather systems unleashing days of intense, widespread downpours.
items.content: Sri Lanka and Indonesia deployed troops on Monday to assist survivors of severe flooding that has killed more than 1,000 people across four Asian countries. Torrential rains swept Sri Lanka, Indonesia’s Sumatra, southern Thailand and northern Malaysia last week, with separate weather systems unleashing days of intense, widespread downpours.

items.title: Death toll passes 900 in Indonesia, Thailand and Sri Lanka floods
items.standfirst: Officials in Indonesia say more than 442 people have died, while Sri Lanka suffers worst natural disaster since 2004 tsunami Authorities in Sri Lanka, Indonesia and Thailand are racing to clear debris and find hundreds of missing people after more than 900 died in devastating floods and landslides across the south of Asia.In the latest example of the impact of the climate crisis on storm patterns and extreme weather, heavy monsoon rains, exacerbated by a tropical storm, have overwhelmed parts of south-east Asia in recent days, leaving thousands of people stranded without shelter or critical supplies. Continue reading...
items.content: Officials in Indonesia say more than 442 people have died, while Sri Lanka suffers worst natural disaster since 2004 tsunami Authorities in Sri Lanka, Indonesia and Thailand are racing to clear debris and find hundreds of missing people after more than 900 died in devastating floods and landslides across the south of Asia.In the latest example of the impact of the climate crisis on storm patterns and extreme weather, heavy monsoon rains, exacerbated by a tropical storm, have overwhelmed parts of south-east Asia in recent days, leaving thousands of people stranded without shelter or critical supplies. items.title: Sri Lanka reels from Cyclone Ditwah as death toll nears 200
items.standfirst: Entire areas of Sri Lanka's capital were flooded on Sunday after a powerful cyclone triggered heavy rains and mudslides across the island, with authorities reporting nearly 200 dead and dozens more missing. Officials said the extent of the damage in the country's worst-affected central region was only just being revealed as relief workers cleared roads blocked by fallen trees and mudslides.
items.content: Entire areas of Sri Lanka's capital were flooded on Sunday after a powerful cyclone triggered heavy rains and mudslides across the island, with authorities reporting nearly 200 dead and dozens more missing. items.title: Sri Lanka death toll from floods and landslides reaches 153
items.standfirst: Another 191 missing after heavy rains from Cyclone Ditwah while almost 78,000 evacuated to temporary shelters amid rescue operationsTorrential rains and floods triggered by Cyclone Ditwah have killed 153 people across Sri Lanka so far, with another 191 still missing, the country’s Disaster Management Centre (DCM) said on Saturday.The DMC director general, Sampath Kotuwegoda, said relief operations were under way with 78,000 people moved to nearly 800 state-run welfare centres after their homes were destroyed by the week-long heavy rains. Continue reading...

clusters.neutral_headline: Pope Leo insists on two-state solution to resolve Israel-Palestine conflict:

items.title: Pope Leo calls for Palestinian state as he continues foreign trip with stop in Lebanon
items.standfirst: Pope Leo was in Lebanon on Sunday night, the second stop on his inaugural foreign trip. Leo told reporters on his plane that the creation of a Palestinian state was the only solution to resolve the decades-long Israeli-Palestinian conflict. Chris Livesay reports from Beirut.
items.content: Pope Leo was in Lebanon on Sunday night, the second stop on his inaugural foreign trip. Leo told reporters on his plane that the creation of a Palestinian state was the only solution to resolve the decades-long Israeli-Palestinian conflict. Chris Livesay reports from Beirut.

items.title: Pope Leo insists on two-state solution to resolve Israel-Palestine conflict
items.standfirst: Crowds welcome Pope Leo in Beirut as he calls for an end to violence and promotes interfaith understanding.
items.content: Crowds welcome Pope Leo in Beirut as he calls for an end to violence and promotes interfaith understanding.

ai_summary: Pope Leo called for a Palestinian state.
He made the statement during his foreign trip in Lebanon.
The Pope believes this is the only solution.
He is promoting interfaith understanding.
The Pope is calling for an end to violence.

clusters.title: 'Qatar GP shows anything can happen in three-way title showdown'

items.title: 'Qatar GP shows anything can happen in three-way title showdown'
items.standfirst: Formula 1 is heading into its first final-race championship showdown between more than two drivers for 15 years, and anything can happen.
items.content: Formula 1 is heading into its first final-race championship showdown between more than two drivers for 15 years, and anything can happen.

items.title: Verstappen wins Qatar GP to keep F1 world championship alive with Norris
items.standfirst: Reigning F1 champion Max Verstappen closed to within 12 points of leader Lando Norris heading into final round in UAE.
items.content: Reigning F1 champion Max Verstappen closed to within 12 points of leader Lando Norris heading into final round in UAE.

items.title: Verstappen's Qatar win takes F1 title fight to final race
items.standfirst: Lando Norris, Max Verstappen and Oscar Piastri will contest a final-race championship showdown in Abu Dhabi after the Red Bull driver won a gripping Qatar Grand Prix.
items.content: Lando Norris, Max Verstappen and Oscar Piastri will contest a final-race championship showdown in Abu Dhabi after the Red Bull driver won a gripping Qatar Grand Prix.

ai_summary: Max Verstappen won the Qatar Grand Prix.
The win sets up a final-race championship showdown.
Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri will also compete.
The final race will be in Abu Dhabi.
The title fight involves more than two drivers.

clusters.title: Looting reported as Indonesia and Sri Lanka battle deadly floods
clusters.neutral_headline: Floods in Indonesia and Sri Lanka cause devastation

items.title: Looting reported as Indonesia and Sri Lanka battle deadly floods
items.standfirst: Indonesian authorities said residents in flood-stricken Sumatra have looted shops for food and water as the death toll climbs to 442 and hundreds remain missing, while Sri Lanka reported at least 193 dead after days of torrential rains and mudslides.
items.content: Indonesian authorities said residents in flood-stricken Sumatra have looted shops for food and water as the death toll climbs to 442 and hundreds remain missing, while Sri Lanka reported at least 193 dead after days of torrential rains and mudslides.

items.title: Indonesia floods death toll rises to 442 as people hunt for food and water
items.standfirst: At least two areas of the worst-affected Sumatra island still unreachable, as authorities struggle to deliver aid.
items.content: At least two areas of the worst-affected Sumatra island still unreachable, as authorities struggle to deliver aid.

ai_summary: Indonesia's death toll from floods rises to 442, with hundreds still missing in Sumatra.
Residents in flood-stricken areas of Sumatra have looted shops for food and water.
Sri Lanka reports at least 193 deaths after days of heavy rain and mudslides.
Authorities are struggling to deliver aid to some of the worst-affected areas in Sumatra.
At least two areas on Sumatra island remain unreachable due to the flooding.

clusters.title: 10-man Chelsea hold Arsenal to draw in feisty London derby
clusters.neutral_headline: Chelsea and Arsenal draw in Premier League match

items.title: 10-man Chelsea hold Arsenal to draw in feisty London derby
items.standfirst: Chelsea produce a defiant performance to hold Premier League leaders Arsenal to a 1-1 draw at Stamford Bridge after going down to 10 men following Moises Caicedo's first-half dismissal.
items.content: Chelsea produce a defiant performance to hold Premier League leaders Arsenal to a 1-1 draw at Stamford Bridge after going down to 10 men following Moises Caicedo's first-half dismissal.

items.title: Merino strikes to earn Arsenal bruising 1-1 draw against 10-man Chelsea
items.standfirst: Mikel Merino cancels out Trevoh Chalobah's opener to spare the Premier League leaders' blushes at Stamford Bridge.
items.content: Mikel Merino cancels out Trevoh Chalobah's opener to spare the Premier League leaders' blushes at Stamford Bridge.

items.title: Chelsea vs Arsenal 1-1: English Premier League – as it happened

items.content: All the updates as Chelsea hold Arsenal to a draw despite going down to 10 men in the first half after Caicedo sees red.

ai_summary: Chelsea and Arsenal played to a 1-1 draw at Stamford Bridge in a Premier League match.
Chelsea played with ten men after Moises Caicedo received a first-half dismissal.
Mikel Merino scored for Arsenal, canceling out Trevoh Chalobah's opening goal.
The draw spared Arsenal's blushes, as they are the Premier League leaders.
The match saw Chelsea hold Arsenal to a draw despite being down a man.

items.content: A widening corruption scandal forced Ukraine's second most powerful person, Andriy Yermak, to resign.

ai_summary: Ukraine's lead negotiator has resigned, shaking up peace talks.
The resignation of Andriy Yermak, Zelenskyy's top aide, occurred.
A widening corruption scandal forced Yermak to resign from his position.
Yermak was the second most powerful person in Ukraine's government.
The resignation could lead to a reboot or a costly shake-up for Kyiv.
